body:
### Problem

Steps:
1. Open neovim
2. Open a text file stored in vim-pad (seems to be file dependent)
3. Hit insert or open

Expected: Don't crash
Actual: Crash :(


This happens periodically, seems to be correlated with specific files, and xmalloc is always in the stack trace, but stack traces area _not_ always the same.


I'm attaching  17 crash logs here. I also have a 3.2gb coredump (note to self: `/cores/core.98604` )if that's useful, I can share that with you privately.
[crash-logs.zip](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/12614345/crash-logs.zip)

If there's more debugging steps I can take or more information that's useful let me know.


<details>
<summary>Crash log sample</summary>


### Steps to reproduce

1. Open neovim
2. Open a text file stored in vim-pad (seems to be file dependent)
3. Hit insert or open
> crash

### Expected behavior

Don't crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.2 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not tested

### Operating system/version

macos 13.4.1

### Terminal name/version

iterm2

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

homebrew

comment_data.body:
Are the any of the vim-pad files anything you can share? (or can be redacted while still producing the issue)

is `s->open_blocks.items` guaranteed to have enough space?

Have a patch here: https://github.com/MDeiml/tree-sitter-markdown/pull/115 testing with the above files/steps this file works on my machine.

For other folks if you want to apply the fix right away.
1. Set treesitter to use the patched branch by adding the config below to init.lua or the lua section in init.vim
2. After adding to the config run `TSInstall markdown markdown_inline` to reinstall those parsers.

init.lua config:
```
local parser_config = require "nvim-treesitter.parsers".get_parser_configs()

parser_config.markdown = {
  install_info = {
    url = "https://github.com/ibash/tree-sitter-markdown.git",
    location = "tree-sitter-markdown",
    files = { "src/parser.c", "src/scanner.c" },
    revision = "ee0dac39fdbc8da1600756e5a19bf618cd79a47c",
  },
  maintainers = { "@MDeiml" },
  readme_name = "markdown (basic highlighting)",
  experimental = true,
}

parser_config.markdown_inline = {
  install_info = {
    url = "https://github.com/ibash/tree-sitter-markdown.git",
    location = "tree-sitter-markdown-inline",
    files = { "src/parser.c", "src/scanner.c" },
    revision = "ee0dac39fdbc8da1600756e5a19bf618cd79a47c",
  },
  maintainers = { "@MDeiml" },
  readme_name = "markdown_inline (needed for full highlighting)",
  experimental = true,
}
```

Thank you for your quick action!
I applied your patch and confirmed that the patch fixed the crash on the above file/steps.
I also tested with what I called "a large markdown file with lists" in my earlier post. No crash so far. Seems to be fixed.
I really appreciate your help!
